Submodules#

Objects

class wavesongs.obj.Song(proj_dirs: ProjDirs, file_id: AnyStr, tlim: Tuple[float] = (0, 60), flim: Tuple[float] = (1000.0, 20000.0), sr: int = 44100, info: Dict = {}, id: AnyStr = 'song')[source]#

Bases: object

Store a song and its properties in a class

Parameters:

  • proj_dirs (ProjDirs)

  • file_id (str) ‚Äì Name or id of the audio sample

  • tlim (tuple) ‚Äì Time range

  • flim (tuple) ‚Äì Frequency range

  • sr (int) ‚Äì Sample rate

  • info (dict) ‚Äì Audio metadata.

  • id (str = "song")

Example

>>>
acoustical_features(llambda: float = 1.0, NN: int = 1024, overlap: float = 0.5, center: bool = False, umbral_FF: float = 1.05, ff_method: AnyStr = 'yin', Nt: int = 100, n_mfcc: int = 4, n_mels: int = 4, stft_window: AnyStr = 'hann', tlim: Tuple[float] | None = None, flim: Tuple[float] | None = None) → None[source]#

Coputing acoustical tempo-spectral variables

Parameters:

  • llambda (float)

  • NN (int)

  • overlap (float)

  • center (bool = False)

  • umbral_FF (int)

  • ff_method (str)

  • Nt (int)

  • n_mfcc (int)

  • stft_window (str)

Return type:

None

Examples

>>>
play() → Audio[source]#

write_audio(bit_depth: int = 16) → None[source]#

class wavesongs.obj.Syllable(file_id: AnyStr | None = None, proj_dirs: ProjDirs | None = None, obj: Any = None, tlim: Tuple[float] = (0, 60), sr: int = 44100, no_syllable: int = 0, id: AnyStr = 'syllable', metadata: Dict = {}, type: AnyStr = '', duration: int | None = None)[source]#

Bases: object

Define a syllable and its properties

Parameters:

  • proj_dirs (ProjDirs | None) ‚Äì Object to manage project directories

  • song (Syllable | Song | None) ‚Äì Object

  • params (dict | None) ‚Äì Diccionary with all or some constat of the physical model motor gestures

  • tlim (tuple) ‚Äì Time range

  • flim (tuple) ‚Äì Frequency range

  • sr (int) ‚Äì Sample rate

  • no_syllable (int) ‚Äì Sylalble number in song

  • id (str) ‚Äì Type of the object, ‚Äúsyllable‚Äù or ‚Äúsynth-syllable‚Äù

  • info (dict) ‚Äì Audio metadata about the audio.

  • type (str) ‚Äì A short description about the part, theme or trill, and the behaviour of the fundamental frequency: plane, up, down, up-down, down-up, and complex. Template: ‚Äú{part}-{behaviour}‚Äù. Example: theme-up

Examples

>>>
acoustical_features(NN: int = 512, ff_method: Literal['yin', 'pyin'] = 'yin', umbral_FF: int = 1, flim: Tuple[float] = (1000.0, 20000.0), Nt: int = 10, center: bool = False, overlap: float = 0.5, llambda: float = 1.5, n_mfcc: int = 4, n_mels: int = 4, stft_window: AnyStr = 'hann') → None[source]#

Coputing acoustical tempo-spectral variables

Parameters:

  • NN (int)

  • llambda (float)

  • overlap (float)

  • center (bool = False)

  • umbral_FF (int)

  • ff_method (str)

  • Nt (int)

  • n_mfcc (int)

  • n_mels (int)

  • stft_window (str)

Plots

wavesongs.plot.alpha_beta(obj: Any, xlim: Tuple[float] = (-0.05, 0.2), ylim: Tuple[float] = (-0.2, 0.9), figsize: Tuple[float] = (10, 6), save: bool = True, show: bool = True) → None[source]#
Parameters:

  • obj (Syllabe|Song) ‚Äì Song or Syllable to be displayed

  • xlim (tuple = (-0.05,.2)) ‚Äì Time range

  • ylim (tuple = (-0.2,0.9)) ‚Äì Frequency range

  • figsize (tuple = (10,6)) ‚Äì Fogure size (width, height)

  • save (bool = True) ‚Äì Enable save plot

  • show (bool = True) ‚Äì Enable display plot

Return type:

None

Example

>>>

  • figsize (tuple = (10,6)) ‚Äì Fogure size (width, height)

  • show (bool = True) ‚Äì Display plot

files_names ‚Äì List with the audios files names

list
